title: Sweeter romantic animations and transitions for the Valentine flow

requirements.summary: Add a subtle ambient romantic background animation (floating hearts/particles) visible on both the question and success screens without blocking interaction.
acceptanceCriteria: On both screens (pre-accept and accepted), an ambient background animation is visible and feels romantic (e.g., slowly floating hearts).
The animation does not block clicking/tapping the Yes button or interacting with the page (background elements must not capture pointer events).
The animation performs smoothly on typical mobile/tablet browsers (no obvious stutter during normal interaction).

file_operations.description: Add a shared ambient background layer rendered for both the question and success states (e.g., an absolutely-positioned container with multiple lightweight heart/particle elements). Ensure the layer uses pointer-events: none and sits behind interactive content. Keep it within the existing single-page Valentine flow (no new pages/routing).

Implement CSS keyframes and utility classes for the ambient floating hearts/particles (including reduced-motion fallbacks via prefers-reduced-motion). Ensure the background animation is GPU-friendly (transform/opacity) and does not intercept pointer events.

requirements.summary: Add smooth, polished transitions when switching from the question screen to the success screen after clicking Yes (fade/scale for the main content).
acceptanceCriteria: Clicking the Yes button triggers a noticeable but subtle transition (fade and/or scale) into the success UI.
No layout jumps or overlapping elements occur during the transition.

file_operations.description: Refactor the current accepted conditional render into a small state machine that supports an animated transition (e.g., animate the question card out, then mount/animate the success card in). Ensure both states share a consistent layout wrapper to avoid layout jumps, and synchronize the state switch with the CSS animation duration.

Add CSS classes/keyframes for card/content enter/exit transitions (fade + slight scale/translate). Include reduced-motion handling to disable or simplify transitions when the user prefers reduced motion.

requirements.summary: Add romantic micro-interactions: enhance Yes button hover/tap feedback and add a playful wiggle cue for the evasive No button without changing its evasive behavior.
acceptanceCriteria: The Yes button has an additional sweet micro-interaction on hover/tap in addition to the existing scale effect.
The No button still moves away on hover/touch/focus as it currently does, and also includes a short playful motion effect that does not prevent it from moving.

file_operations.description: Use the shadcn-ui Button component (already in use) to keep consistent styling while adding a new class hook for enhanced hover/active feedback on the Yes button (e.g., glow/shimmer overlay) and apply a short wiggle class to the No button immediately before/while it repositions. Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.

Add CSS for the Yes button micro-interaction (e.g., subtle glow/shimmer using pseudo-elements and opacity/transform) and a short wiggle keyframe for the No button that can be triggered via a class toggle. Ensure animations don’t interfere with the No button’s existing movement logic and include reduced-motion fallbacks.
